name: kit
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ C ] a set of things, such as tools or clothes, used for a particular purpose or activity: a first-aid/tool kit a pregnancy-testing kit
[ C ] a set of parts sold ready to be put together: He's making a model car from a kit.
A2 [ U ] mainly UK the particular clothing worn by a sports team, or the particular clothing and small pieces of equipment worn and used by people such as soldiers and sailors: They were wearing football kit.
Fuse/Corbis/GettyImages
[ S or U ] mainlyUK the equipment needed for a particular purpose or activity: Don't go and buy all the kit until you know what sort of sailing you enjoy. A torch is an important piece of kit on backpacking trips.
More examplesFewer examplesI bought a new cycle repair kit.We didn't have our sports kit with us.Where is the first-aid kit?My Mum washes my rugby kit for me.Luckily, she had her doctor's kit with her.
